Card Description: Here's when we learnt how brands increase customers loyalty.
Card Body:
The second WHS was all about the world of brands & how to crack community building by the core of it.

Community building follows a simple formula:  90-9-1.

üõ∏ 90% are passive participants

üïπÔ∏è 9% respond

üéØ 1% create

Then we look into how to start your group on a collaborative path


Purposeful, Participatory, Repeatable

üåà Make it purposeful

‚õ≥ Make it participatory

üöÄ Make it repeatable


Marketing v/s Community building

Marketing views people as an aggregate and seeks to communicate with them as a whole, efficiently.

Community-focused communications view people as individuals and aim to delight the few then extrapolate that experience to others.


For a brand, their customers are their community. But the level of belonging and commitment are different to different people. From founders to consumers‚Ä¶ they are all part of the community, but differ in sense of belonging.‚ÄùDavid Spinks, (Founder of CMX)


Why should brands build community?

A strong brand community can:

- Increase customer loyalty

- Lower marketing costs

- Authenticate brand meanings

- Yield an influx of ideas to grow the business

Through commitment, engagement, and support, companies can cultivate brand communities that deliver powerful returns. When a community is done right, the benefits are irrefutable.


Which brands according to you have got the community-building aspect figured out? Let us know know in comments below!

Card Description: The Comment with 0 upvotes will have a card dedicated to that Space Warrior
Card Body: It's time to see how persistent you really are?üëÄ

Card Title: My MoU Story 01: Confirming My Convincing Skills
Card Description: Imagine the first college visit: A one on meeting with the principal.
Card Body:
My grandfather always told everyone that I have an amazing convincing skill and if  I wanted I could convince anyone and everyone. I never believed it so Today was going to be the first test of that skill I was told I have because I had to convince my management. 

When I say my management I mean a campus in the state of Jharkhand. If you ask me people here are a bit orthodox so change is out of the question at times. But I can never give up without trying because then my anxiety will kill me. So I gathered my courage and went for it.

I thought of getting it signed by my teacher first and then go to my principal so I asked my cousins who was the most chill teacher on the campus and I wanted to approach them first. So they told me that our HOD was an amazingly chill person and he could definitely sign my MOU. But, "thanks" to the pandemic I didn't even know where his cabin was. He stays in the department of commerce but where was it??

I had never been to my college before, I didn't know a single office or class in there. After searching the entire college for half an hour and not finding a thing I thought of an amazing idea 'to ask someone'.

So I asked an employee and to my shame, it was right behind me. I went up to the cabin and found out it was locked. The peon told me that he was in a meeting and will be there for another two hours. My heart sank, I couldn't wait there for two hours it was the last day of exams and the college would close after this till further notice so it was my last chance.

Thus I decided to march indirectly to my principal for the permission.

I went up to him, presented my pitch beautifully and I could say he was impressed. As I was about to finish the last line I mentioned about the Summit and his face dropped.

He returned me my MOU and said this is not what we do in our college and asked me to go see the vice principal for he is responsible for the cultural department.

I knew it was going to be difficult after this because if my principal wasn't convinced my Vice Principal wouldn't either.

So I walked up to my Vice Principal's cabin with a bit of disappointment. But then I remembered my grandfather's words who always says that my smile could convince anyone so I smiled as wide as I could and entered his cabin.

I stuttered a bit in the beginning but then I gathered myself and presented everything that I had prepared. I told him how Under 25 was an organisation that organised on campus and off-campus events and it would help us in various skills like communication, culture building, leadership and many other. I also told him about the amazing speakers we get to learn from. I showed him the MOU and mentioned all the things that were written in it.

I expressed how badly I wanted to take part in it.

To my surprise, he got convinced.

He just asked me two questions:

Where the program would be held for the rest of the 10 months and second will it affect my studies?

- I told him that the program is now happening online and the Summit will be held after 10 months based on my performance and also that the engagement in this didn't require much of my time and that the Weekly Hang Sesh are held on Saturdays for an hour.

He agreed and signed the MOU he also signed up to be the faculty advisor. I thanked him and left his cabin.



I couldn't believe I had done it. I sent a picture of the signed MOU to Keerthan and Kanishka my Student Culture Team and also to everyone I knew in the fellowship just to confirm that I had actually done it and was not dreaming. After 4 assurance calls and one final assurance call from Keerthan, I believed that I had done it and could leave the college only then. 



Well in the end I realised that maybe my grandfather was right and I shouldn't doubt him and also that a smile could convince anyone and everyone.

Article by: Ritika Modi

Space Warrior at St. Xavier's College Ranchi.

Card Title: MoU Story 02: From being a Rebel to Teacher's Star
Card Description: I made a new friend outside the legal advisor's cabin & then got it signed!
Card Body:
When it comes to management, initially I thought it would be an easy go ride for me because I had already brought in one club before. Unfortunately, my favourite teacher left college - this brought me in a tough spot to get the MoU signed. BUT I got up, went to the HoD, just gave him a whole presentation about Under 25 for a half-hour. At the end of it, he had only one question for me, "Will our department get a plus point in the college trophy?", I was like 'yes sir we will definitely get an extra point.'


That's all he needed to hear and told me to get a sign from the required faculty.

Here comes the tough part - I was the one student who never attended any lectures and even if I did, the teachers used to kick me out plus my favourite teacher was not there.

I ended up talking to more than four teachers about signing the MoU but they didn't as I was the rebel. This was all done on Friday 20th August in one day. I just got my HoD's sign. It was easy, just talk to him well and the assurance of winning the trophy got that sign.

Now comes Monday 23rd of August, and to be honest, I had no hopes that any teacher will sign it but still, I went to college, was just roaming around HoD's cabin because I thought he would help me to get a teacher's signature but my luck got in chance and met two of my seniors, they saw me a bit tensed so they asked what's the problem?

I told them I need a faculty to sign on the MoU and they suggested I go to Talhar sir - the management faculty from our Department of Computers.

He asked three questions:

- How did you get selected in Under 25?

- What is the benefit of it?

- What do you want from my side?



I answered them all, how I got selected and how my friend from MIT helped me get this chance, and all the perks.

He was shocked when I told him they provide a chance to build a community. It was better than doing nothing on campus, and for this answer, he was impressed and told me, "I will support you but tell me what I need to do?"

"Just want your support", was my answer. *Mic Drop*


He agreed and told me to go directly to meet Principal Sir. So, I went to the principal, had a talk with him formally, gave him a brief intro, and then he told me to drop the papers here and that he will read them and sign on Wednesday. I was like "ok Sir will collect on that day", I had no choice otherwise. But when I went on Wednesday, Principal sir sent the papers to the legal advisor of our college he said I will read it and give it to you tomorrow.




I was feeling scared at this moment, will he sign it or not but was hung on with the faith. I went on Thursday, he still hadn't read it and told me to come the next day. So, I went on Friday but that day before speaking to the Principal, I went to Talhar sir, to get him to speak to the legal advisor so I can get an early paper sign. He had a call and told me to go in half-hour, he will give me the paper. I went near the cabin after half an hour but he had the same answer,

"I am still reading when I am done I will call you till then sit outside."

And then I Sat outside his cabin and waited till 5 PM outside the legal advisor because I wanted to get it signed no matter what.

While I was waiting there many students came and went, I even made a new friend outside the legal advisor cabin, and then finally I got it signed.


The happiness was so profound that I started dancing in the principal's cabin.

The learning I can say is to "trust the process, have patience, don't give up until the end, ask questions and ask for help", there will be people always there to help you.

Article By Neha Agarwal,

Space Warrior at AISSMSCOE /All India Shri Shivaji Memorial Society College of Engineering Pune

Card Title:
My MoU Story 03: 
Tension v/s smile
Card Description: It's a mind full of confusion and the coolest staff of my college.
Card Body:
It was a lazy day, with the clock almost hitting 9 in the morning. It was raining, while I checked my emails and messages as it poured heavily outside.

As soon as I got my reminder, I called up my class teacher Mrs Soumya regarding a confusion with my assignments, but as the call came to it's end, I subtly pitched Under 25 to her.

After a long conversation, Mrs Soumya then connected me to the H.O.D Mr Roji Thomas, who turned out to be very polite and understanding of everything I was to say.



Once I convinced him, my next challenge was to convince my Principal Fr.Joshy Cheeramkuzhy CMI.

With immense hope, I presented to him, everything that I had learnt about Under 25 over the last 3 months. It was a massive relief when he accepted my proposal and permitted me.



A myriad of emotions overtook me. I've never been so happy before this moment!

This day was not only about getting the MoU signed, but it was about me taking the next step in my college life. This day made me feel like I was someone who was capable of doing something great!

I am definitely going to make a change with this newfound confidence in me.

It's noon and I went back to my home.



A war between tension and relief -  is the perfect description of what went down today.

Article by Philip Sunny

Space Warrior at Kristu Jyoti College of Management and Technology

Card Title: My MoU Story 04: Par for the course
Card Description: If smooth sailing was ever a distilled series of interactions
Card Body:
Asian Institute of Design is a college that specializes in courses for game development and animation in particular.



As such my faculty members belong to a much younger age group, as a result of which, they have a lot more knowledge of pop culture and the like.

I had notified the staff about my selection since July itself, and they had quite happily endorsed my endeavours. For me, the MoU was just a formality.



We had exams and submissions all through August whilst our campus compound underwent a sleek renovation. In the midst of all that, our faculty was busy communicating with BNU, making sure the logistics of our examinations were secured.

Once we finally got some time to breathe freely, I swiftly took the MoU to my Student coordinator's office where we exchanged some quick pleasantries and casually discussed some ongoing topics.

Soon enough, once I was sure about the specifics on what details to include, it was quickly signed and we took a nice, casual picture.

It was a smooth, cordial, and friendly experience wherein I felt glad I chose this college.

He commended me on taking the initiative for this college and was quite enthused about how fun the collaborations were done by Under 25.


He also lauded the fact that I was representing Under 25 for this college to the other faculties present there.

Before leaving, he assured me the college would help with whatever was needed to make this work. It was a solid experience and I felt jubilant all the way through.

I knew I could win the 3 round
s, and I knew my faculty would support me. And I knew once I got in, I would have no problem representing my college with their help. All par for the course

Article By Hindol Chakraborty

Space Warrior at Asian Institute of Design

Card Title: My MoU Story 05: My HoD took the MoU too seriously
Card Description: The adventure to the hills for getting my MoU signed!
Card Body:
Article by Vanishree Kulkarni

Space Warrior at Cambridge Institute of Technology


Post the announcement of us receiving the MoU, I was a bit anxious and nervous at the same time, to approach my faculty because after almost 2 years of online classes and never interacting with them other than zoom calls, I was scared to approach them.



The next day I went to college to meet my HoD, there I found my third Semester class teacher, the most chill and kind-hearted teacher you'd ever meet. After explaining to her everything about the fellowship, she proposed to be the faculty coordinator and showed utter support towards the initiative. Then I pitched for the MoU to my HoD.



With God's grace, it went so well that it ended up with my Principal and College CEO applauding me for taking this incredible initiative up. All of them were really proud of me. I thought this was it, it's finally happening but then the Principal asked for 3 days to review the MoU.

After anxiously waiting for 3 days, he told me there are no issues and he'll sign it but he had a few TERMS and CONDITIONS attached to that - yes!

He wanted me to carry out few more activities since I was a "Space Warrior".

While reading through the annexures he found a topic called 'Social Responsibility" and that I should reflect the same by going with my teachers to a rural place to talk about women empowerment and the importance of education.


So, on 25th August (Wednesday) morning, I went with my teachers to a place called Konganhalli which is almost 90 km from my college. Once we reached that place, the school which we were supposed to go to was a very tiny place between the hills.



I got the chance to meet a lot of 6th-7th standard girls who were very excited to meet us. Speaking to them about how education is crucial and how it is even more important for girls.

I had to give a speech in Kannada which was sort of a challenge because I don't speak Kannada that well and of course stage fright, but I somehow managed it. Later we disturbed chocolates and donated few books.



I loved the entire experience because I got the chance to bond with my teachers as well as learn from them on how activities are planned and carried out. It was such a happy feeling to see that my teachers were very supportive of whatever I was doing.


I always felt that our college does not support these extracurricular activities. But apart from that I do feel our college is really good academic-wise and now it's going to be even better in extracurricular activities!


So finally on Thursday (26th August 2021), he signed the MoU, almost after 1 week. It felt great to get the approval from the college and get Under 25 kick-started!

Card Title: My MoU Story 06: Approval Without Signature?
Card Description: With Love, To the Supportive Management and Teachers!
Card Body:
Article By Akhila B Mukundan

Space Warrior at Christ Nagar College, Maranalloor

Describing my journey to getting the MoU signed, I was sure I could do it. Naah, not my overconfidence, but something in me said, "You can do it Akhila!"



Me, being the First-Ever Space Warrior from my college, fortunately, the management did appreciate it.

This was the main reason for my confidence. On top of that, my teachers and I were on good terms (that was the hope, at least) As and when I approached more people, explained to them what I am doing, the response was positive.



After a really long time, I was back in college again for my semester exams, when I had the conversation with our Manager, Rev. Fr. Titto Varghese CMI. He gave me an instant reply.

"Let's start a page. Just bring any documents they give for signing", were his words.

Imagine having the approval even before having MoU in your had.

Almost a month after that, I finally received the MoU for signing. BUT!! The college was closed for Onam vacation.

There was no way I could get it signed before the 31st of August. Again, I reached out to my sir for being the Faculty advisor.

Truth to be told, he was the person who edited all the "Insert" areas of the MoU and printed the document. And then comes 31st August, Signing Day!!!

The MoU was printed with all details except our Principal's signature, that too sir got it done for me and finally IT WAS DONE!



I'm very glad to have had the sincere support and guidance of each and every person mentioned in this really long description of the "Journey of Getting the MoU Signed" especially Rajesh sir, who was with me throughout the process.



My happiness after the moment can't be described because when the signing was getting extended, I was really anxious even though there wasn't even a single negative comment or response, and finally having the signed MoU, the smile on my face is the most sincere and the sweetest one you are ever gonna see ‚ù§Ô∏è

Card Title: My MoU Story 07: No problem I'll wait
Card Description: This is how its done Thrupthi
Card Body:
Article by Thrupthi Sumanth

Space Warrior at Brindavan Group of Institutes

It was around mid-July when I started dropping hints about the Fellowship to my department‚Äôs principal.

I had to send in my pitch, and I wanted to be sure that a campus page was something my management would agree with. To my luck, my principal Ar. Kalpana Manchali caught on and was excited about it. She even helped me with my pitch to the management (am I not a lucky girl?!).



And then look at the turn of events. Two weeks went by, radio silence. So, I decided to personally meet with her.

Upon meeting her I learned that our entire management had changed, NEW chairman appointed, NEW student ambassador as well, and neither of them had an interest in it.

My face dropped. She looked and consoled me, said that 'If I really wanted it then I could make it happen.'

‚ÄòBeing nervous isn‚Äôt bad. It just means something important is happening ‚Äò                                                                                                   -Michael Jordan

That‚Äôs what Michael Jordan said. I second every bit of that. But where will my mind think about inspirational quotes when I‚Äôm anxiously waiting for the student ambassador in her cabin.




She finally came, greeted me, and asked me to explain Under 25.

I did, but I failed to do so successfully because I was that nervous. Regardless, she asked me to write a letter and bring her a copy of the MoU so she could pass it on to the management and asked me to come on the following Monday.



I was in her office at 9:30 AM on Monday, with a letter in my hand and with so much more confidence than the last time. Someone comes in and tells me that she would not be available till 12:30 pm. No problem at all! I could wait.

At 12:30 I go to her office and the staff just stops me right outside the door, says she‚Äôs busy and asked me to come the next day.

Fine by me! I head home and come back the next day only to be told that she cannot meet me that day as well.

Now, I lost it. I know, I know, do I have the right to be mad at such high authority personals? They might be very busy for all I know. But that day I didn‚Äôt want to drive 30 km for anything.

So, I made up my mind to go and talk to my principal and ask her to help me out.



My principal might have been in a good mood that day because she was all smiles and warm when she saw me (insert teary-eyed emoji). I told her what had happened, so she called the dean's office directly and set up a meeting with him.

Cut to 10 minutes later we are in the dean‚Äôs office; my principal is sitting on a chair in front of me while I stand. My legs literally are jelly (I‚Äôm usually good at talking to people, but don‚Äôt know what happened).

I explain to the dean what it is and then he asks me a three questions:

1) Will it interfere with the normal working of the college?

2) What all I would require to start the club?

3) If my principal and I had read the MoU?



That was all needed for him to take out his green pen and sign the letter and write ‚Äòpermission granted for Under 25‚Äô. That was it! It took us just 5 minutes to do this. We walked out of the dean‚Äôs office and my principal looks at me smiling and say ‚Äòthat‚Äôs how you do it Thrupthi ‚Äò.

I honestly felt so blessed and was so grateful that I had her by my side because, without her, I do not know how I would have done it. So, thank you very much Kalpana ma‚Äôam.

Cheers to new beginnings!


(I don't have a picture with the MoU, but the picture I've attached was clicked by my friend when I was telling her about me getting it finally signed. It's a happy candid picture )

Card Title: My MoU Story 08: Rishab had to drop by!
Card Description: The right person at the right time always works!
Card Body:
Article by Shaik Muskan

Space Warrior at HKBK College of Engineering


I'm that person who waits for the right time to approach anything and everything, so that's what I did even this time.

I didn't inform my management when I got selected but I was waiting for the MoU, read it thoroughly marked all the main points, the intro, the work we do, and of course campus benefits, and made a presentation of that to make it convenient.



Then the thought of the right person to approach first came, which was our college student counsellor. Mr Vinay - was he the right person? Yes, he was! Went to the college, spoke to him, made him understand what Under 25 is, it wasn't that easy though.

He did his research, we made him believe that it's secure and beneficial. He was so understanding and patient.

And then I had already thought of a perfect Professor for the faculty advisor Ms Sumaiya Banu, she is the coolest and helpful person, who agreed to help me out.

So, Vinay sir took an appointment and discussed it with the Principal about this, and then they told us to call anyone who is part of Under 25 to get it signed, I was a little stressed if this would happen or not.



I requested them through the mail and a day after Aisha the Director of Student Culture replied that it may be difficult to come but can we set up a virtual meeting, okay so now this was the plus point that my College is located in Bangalore and near to the office of Under 25, told this to Aisha and she agreed to meet! You can imagine how happy I was at that time.


That week was like a roller coaster ride for me. Wednesday 1st September was the date, Aisha wasn't able to make it but Rishab and Rohit came over.

They were so kind and friendly in fact, Rohit was familiar with the place and Rishab was enjoying looking around.



They met our Professors and gave them all the detailed information which cleared their doubts. We were waiting for the Principal to get the sign done as he was busy with the exam work.

I felt so sorry to make them wait, but he came back, we all went to his cabin, got it signed finally without any queries - Thank God!



Clicked some pictures then came out with happy faces. We all had some snacks and our Professor gave us a pizza party hehe.

Honestly, I didn't have much hope but tried my level best to convince them and make it happen. It wouldn't have been possible without all these people and my friends, so grateful for that too.

The struggle was worth it! A great start of the month with an amazing opportunity.

Card Title: What Internships mean to SW‚Äôs: SWF A Edition
Card Description: Here's what went down in yesterday's space chat take over!
Card Body:
Article by Aastha Roy, Hindol Chakraborty, Jyothika Kambhampati, Pannagasri G & Sahil llave.

Internships are what students usually go for in search of exposure, connections, experience or to improve their skills. Some even use internships as a tool to get a feel of what it would be like to work in a particular field.

Companies that offer these internships use it to recruit their best employees without having the committed long period assessment of an actual employee.


Topic: What‚Äôs your best-case scenario?: Internship edition.


Fun facts

Paradox had a financial existential crisis, Pannaga often confused ‚ÄúInternships‚Äù with ‚Äúrelationships‚Äù, Aastha was busy with her internship, Sahil learnt about cosmetics while we planned, Jyothika was ignored during takeover and accidentally got aggressive?üòÇWe all jammed out to a bomb playlist!üî•




Takeaways:

- It has been normalized over the last two decades that it's expected to work a normal office job for free, for exposure, connections, etc.

- Organizations asking for experience from first-year students is not funny!

- Availability of internships vary immensely based on the domain.

- Many corporates fail to adhere to basic work etiquettes like communicating only during office hours.

- Non-monetary values >>> monetary benefits

- Never do anything that doesn‚Äôt come under your job description.


Best workplace features:

1. That nurtures your skills and helps you growüåª

2. You are respected like any other employee üß©

3. Gives you exposure and connections üé∞

4. Check whether the value added to you is on par with the amount of time and effort that goes into your internship üéØ

5. Last, but the most important! Do something that you are passionate about! This will not only help you build a future in that field but you will also enjoy it while doing so! üíé


Add On's: 

- You should learn to manage your work-college- life balance no matter how much the workload is to reap maximum benefits from it, by scheduling your work or other activities.




- Take any remarks positively as constructive criticism and work on improving yourself. But you should also know when it's crossing the limit.


Youngsters are often exploited through unpaid internships lured by the words ‚Äúexperience‚Äù and ‚Äúconnections‚Äù which are not always achieved. So make sure you get that network!



- Anything you learn is not a waste. You never know when it will come to use.


Special mentions: Athar and Rabia were really helpful with guidelines and tips!üíï

And of course Koustubh and Aisha for guiding us through it!‚ù§Ô∏è


All in all, It was 1hour 15 minutes filled with useful insights and bonding.üíïüíï

SWF A x Woke Wednesdays üíé

Card Title: My MoU Story 09: Fortunate or not so fortunate?
Card Description: What seemed to be a one-day process turned out to be nine!
Card Body:
Article by Pannagasri G

Space Warrior at BMS COLLEGE FOR WOMEN


Here's some context about my college: BMS College for Women, has a legacy of 64 years and supports both the academic and cultural development of a student equally with several clubs and events that a student can participate in! But what's missing was the collaboration between different courses, a common platform for all students to come together, other than the occasional cultural gatherings.



And this is my story of getting that signature on the MoU

I had already intimated my class teacher, who I hoped would be my faculty advisor, about me representing Under 25 at our college, in June! She was all for it.

Determined to do this with me and was really excited that I was doing something more than just my degree. It took one phone call to get her on board and voila! I have a faculty advisor.

As far as my pitch goes for the management, I unfortunately but just a bit, fortunately, didn't have to do any of it. (Fortunate you'd say)


She spoke to the HoD, who spoke to the Principal briefly before presenting the MoU. It was all set, the MoU edited and printed, and when I could almost reach and grasp it, gone.

The NEP autonomous peer committee was visiting our college in two days and everyone was buried in work. 

This was huge. They had the power to decide whether the college could be an autonomous body. And hence, my MoU was at the end of the list.

The next few days went like this:

28th August:  I go to college after scouring through every single document I have of Under 25 on the way in the car to face the Principal. But apparently, the MoU had to go through a whole cricket team before it reached the Principal (not exaggerating). 

29th August:  The campus management had approved it!

31st August: The chairperson of the BMS group of institutions had approved it- had a mini celebration with pizzas!üòÇ

1st September: It was a long wait before it got to the Principal's chamber. This corridor had become way too familiar to me by this time.



One thing that kept me occupied was the attendee.

A sweet lady who sits outside the Principal's chamber, with the mask on for 11 hours straight, probably making the wait of students like me a bit more comfortable.

We chatted about her routine, my lack of common sense to bring lunch, and all that Miss Rona has done to the world.



I was then called inside to only be informed that a student should never go there without staff and to send for my faculty advisor and HoD. Curveball. My faculty advisor and the HoD who were the only two people who knew about Under 25 were out of college and unavailable.

I had to explain what Under 25 was and how we would benefit from it to the only lecturer left in the department, who knew nothing about Under 25, in less than a minute so that she could speak to the Principal.




Whatever I said had worked! The MoU came out, signed, after a while. At this point, I hadn't eaten anything since that morning. Super hungry but even happier! As for how I felt after getting the MoU signed, I listened to "FEELING GOOD" by Michael Bubl√© on the bus on my way back home.




A lesson that I learned is that these processes take a long time and that's because they are very essential to make sure you give the best to your students! All you have to do is stay positive and be patient!‚ö°

And I am grateful for my Faculty advisor who encouraged me and was there for all of it!‚ù§Ô∏è

Card Title: Maybe lockdown wasn't all that bad üåª
Card Description: How I learnt to effectively use my time better ‚è∞
Card Body:
Let me give you some back story before I tell you all this story


I'm someone who lives¬†**13 kilometres away from my college.**¬†People who live far away from college would relate but everything I did had like a + 1-hour time limit to it üò©
If we have to reach college at 7:30

I had to get up around 6 (Every day!)ü§ß
Jumpcut to the lockdown! üß± Honestly saying I was very happy that I didn't have to go anymore cause I was already¬†Interning with Under 25. Not going to college meant I¬†get 2-3 extra hours¬†in a day! WOOHOOL That's when I had¬†full control of my schedule¬†and I started mapping out my daysüåª I came up with this theory which was is the¬† "Zero Delay policy"

Zero Delay Policy: Following time to the T without delaying any task.

Example:¬†If I had to do something at 2 PM I have to start sharp at 2. Not 2:03 or 2:05, sharp at 2 as¬†now I don't have to wait for the lift or maybe find parking?

And this is my favourite NOT GET STUCK IN TRAFIC!


So that's what really worked out for me & I'm still trying to practice the zero delay policy & trust me homies it does wonders üîé Let me know how far you live from your college in the comments!

Also, drop a ‚è∞ if you liked my idea of the zero delay policy ‚ù§

Card Title: Dear Fellows, You are the chosen ones!
Card Description: Welcome to the campus space!
Card Body:
You Are The Chosen One

Dear Campus Space Warriors, 


Well, here we are! After 3 months of madness, experiencing Drills, Projects & your endless meetings with your management! You made it, we made it.üå§


You must be wondering where did I come from and how do I fit here? Now that's a story to tell! I don't know where to start from but here it is... 


I come from Pune and I studied in this college called MIT WPU, heard of it before? No worries! For everyone who doesn't know my campus, it has 25,000 students, ain't that crazy?üéà


As I became a Space Warrior of this humongous campus in my second year of college there was so much going on in my mind. üéü


Permissions? Summit? Page? Team? I had so much to figure out all by myself. Doesn't sound anything less than a script of a superhero movie right? 


Jumpcut to October 2019üéó

We organised 3 pre-event activities, launched 5 campaigns and everyone on our campus was just talking about how much fun everyone was having because of us.

It was just me and this cute little team that decided to push boundaries & give the students of MIT-WPU an experience like never before.


Here are few highlights that will give you all a visual treat of what I am talking about:


Summit Launch üõ©



Dabba Party (First Live IP) üçû



Humans Snakes & Ladders üêç




Back in our days üë®üèª‚Äçüè´ (One of my personal favourite campaigns!)



Open mic üéô



At my heart, I always knew why I was doing this & that really derived me to go all-out every single day üíØ

‚Ä¢ I was doing it for the students of my campus who didn't have this lovely opportunity. I wanted to do my best in representing them! üåå

‚Ä¢ I knew I was not going to get a chance like this again in my college life to impact so many people at this scale üå†

‚Ä¢ For all the moments when we felt we were too young to pull off something like this without prior experience üåï


We did it all from scratch and I can proudly say that we were the flag bearer of the first-ever Under 25 Campus Summit in Pune and we have created history.



Dream big and work towards it, nothing is impossible, the sky is only the limit or in our case, I would say space is our limit as you all are the chosen ones üí´




All of this is happening and all of this is real so let's embrace it together ‚ù§
Am I Right? Or Am I right üëÄ

Card Description: 6 days to go!
Card Body:
6 days to go until you submit your Spaceboard!


You crack this and 50% of your Spaceboard is c-o-m-p-l-e-t-e.


>Aim for the day: Writing your code and philosophy


Defining CODE


üîà a set of principles that are accepted and used by a society or a particular group of people


By writing the code you set up a base in bringing like-minded people together. The place that would define the culture of your space which would enhance the interest of the Space.


For instance,


Solid Waste Management defines its code with 3 Rs - Reuse, Reduce, Recycle


The Marketing Mix defines its code with 4 Ps - Product, Price, Place, Promotion


Similarly, Snapchat Opinion Leader Program defines its code with 4 Es - Extract, Experience, Evolve, Experiment


It's not restricted to just use this way of writing a code but also:


Amazon - Think Big. Earn Trust. Dive Deep. Deliver Results. 


Walt Disney - If we take care of our guests and our cast members, the rest takes care of itself.


Student Matter at Under 25 - We collectively persist to make everyone feel safe, seen and celebrated.


Pro Tip: You can choose that one letter that's most apt for your Identity Space to define your code in the easiest way possible


Defining PHILOSOPHY


üîà a theory or attitude that acts as a guiding principle for behavior


By writing the philosophy you reflect upon your learnings as a Space Warrior. The place that would identify what you and your members believe in.


For instance,


IKEA - to create a better everyday life for the many people. Our business idea supports this vision by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible will be able to afford them.


Microsoft - To empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more.


Starbucks - To inspire and nurture the human spirit ‚Äì one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time.


Student Matter at Under 25 - Building a generation of students who have the opportunity to unlock their full potential through our systems & frameworks.


have you got this? or HAVE YOU GOT THIS? üëÄ


Exercise Time


Drop the answers in the comments below


A simple exercise for you is to identify which is code or philosophyüì£:


1. Chanel - To be the Ultimate House of Luxury, defining style and creating desire, now and forever

2. Nike - Bring inspiration to every athlete in the world

3. Chanel - Freedom, women's liberation, passion for creativity, ultimate luxury, uniqueness, feminine elegance, simplicity, and class. 

4. Nike - inspiration, innovation, authentic, connected, and distinctive.

Card Description: Here's how Under 25 MCC made noise on their campus yesterday!
Card Body:
Under 25 MCC 


A tradition to withhold and carry forward- 


Every year Mount Carmel College comes up with a sign-up drive that goes on for two days, where more than sixty associations of MCC come together and set up registration counters for the students to register.

MCC Under 25 had its first-ever sing-up this year on the 4th and 5th of October in one of the most happening places of MCC, the Amphitheatre. 

The purpose of conducting a sign-up drive was to meet enthusiastic content creators and introduce them to Under 25, to anchor a platform to their talent by having them as a part of our team. 

Curating eye-catching announcement posters, answering all the possible queries of the students regarding Under 25, engaging with our Instagram audiences on a regular basis, and mainly motivating the intimidated students during the sign-up helped us to resonate with them as well as make them comfortable in their skin.


By the end of the 2nd day, which is the last day, we had received around 100 registrations. 


All the constant efforts put in by each of our team members reflected in the final outcome and we celebrated it by playing some music and grooving with each other. 


Under 25 MCC is a complete package of fun, curating relatable and trending content, host events as well as campaigns that made a difference in society. We created engaging content on Instagram and gained a lot of traction and followers.


MCC centric content worked the best which had an average of 50k views. Reels such as "Most-asked questions, campus tour, and go-to outfits for a Carmelite" have gained the most traction whilst increasing the number of followers. 


Our recent IG TV about the teams was to give an idea of how we work as a team and coordinate with each other. This was a part of our signup drive where we educated them on what Under 25 MCC as a whole does and what it is all about.  Radical Empathy was a campaign where our team helped the ones in need during a tough second wave of covid which was a step towards creating an impact on society.


Shivika & Pavitra also added

Our main objective is to spread happiness, positivity, as well as inclusivity.  


We provide a platform to showcase one‚Äôs talent. We have hosted offline and online events where the participants have blown our minds with their cool dance moves, or their melodious voices and are hoping to host more such events, content, and most of all have fun in the year ahead. 


Lastly, talking about our future operations, we wish to coexist on both Instagram and on the Under 25 app. We build our Instagram page from scratch and love curating content, conducting events and engaging our followers. Branching it on the Under 25 app in the future and being successful is something we‚Äôre manifesting.

Card Description: F-i-v-e days to go! üî∞
Card Body:
The most doubts I have been receiving from y'all is regarding the format section of the Spaceboard.


To define Format, it is the way in which something is arranged or set out.


Here are a few points to address all the misconceptions of the Format:


‚ùå Format can't be changed once made.


‚ùå Format isn't restricted to the genre of content your cards will fall into.


‚ùå Format shouldn't just be content buckets like LOL, Recommendation, Information, etc.


To conclude, regardless of the medium you choose, Under 25 App or Instagram, Format can be executed anywhere and everywhere including offline and online events.


With that said, you can write a 6-month calendar as your format or the types of cards you want to post on your space.


Here's an example to write your Format:


Example A üõí


If you want to write your format as a 6-month calendar:


The XYZ Fashion Club was built with the intent to enable students across the country to build fashion culture, take dress codes seriously, develop makeup skills and interact with some of the smartest and fashionable minds in India. XYZ Fashion Club caters to its hyperlocal community and up its fashion game while introducing everyone to the world of Runway Reality.


The XYZ Fashion Club lasts for 6 months, and during their tenure aim to carry out numerous Trials from which they unlock learnings, experiences, and rewards. The curriculum of the club is curated by the Space Warrior, while making sure the student is always at the core.


The Club kicks off with the FC Induction, a 2-hour session that dives into depth of what the role of a Member is as well as the format of the club.


The XYZ Fashion Club League, a Squad format of the program occurs twice during the tenure of a Member. It is the show stopper for all Members looks forward to eagerly.


On a weekly basis, the FC Common Room is held where we discuss goals, learn new things, and celebrate past highlights and achievements.


The Club concludes with The FC Graduation on the 6th month, where the Members reflect on everything they've achieved in the past year.


Example BüßØ


If you want to write your format as a type of card:


The Format for XYZ Fashion Club to discuss month on month covers the following but is not limited to:


Lifestyle: This card will cover everything fashion


Recommendation: Some good ol' recommendations about fashion creators for the members


Relate: This card will talk about fashion, runway and makeup that all members will relate to


Do you wanna go ahead with Example A, B or create your own example C? Let me know in the comments!

Card Title: What business would you kick-start with Rs.100000?
Card Description: Think about it and drop it in the comments below!
Card Body:
As students, we always have this idea in the back of our head, however small it is, that one day we'll run our own business.

Personally, I think a college Xerox shop is the best business one can own haha! üòå


But on a slightly larger scale, I have tons of friends who have kick-started their own ventures, whether it was a thrift store, a resin jewellery store, or even an online bakery!


What made them successful, was that they had a Unique Selling Point (USP) which separated them from their competition! 


So,

What would be a business you would kick-start and would be unique about it?


Go wild with your responses, there is no correct answer!

There are a total of 9 different things!

Once you see it you can't unsee it


Let's see how many of you can get itü§î

Card Description: Let me break that down for you üî¶
Card Body:
Writing your 6 cards is not an easy task so firstly take a chill pill üê•




But let me break that for you, let me try and make this process easy! 


In today's edition of "Let me break that for you", we will be discussing your First Card. 


Your first card is going to be the most honest one there, the one where you open up about how much this space means to you and why was this truly created in the first place.


It is more or less like an open letter to everyone joining your space! So, how do you capture that? By simply being HONEST to your words and emotions.


These were 1/6 launch cards of our Spaces, where we welcomed our members to our universes and the whole purpose of the same.





All you need to do is, Open your notes and start answering these questions. 


 üåª What does it mean to be a space warrior for your campus?

üåª What's your vision with your campus space?

üåª What are some things everyone should look out for in your space?

üåª How will I be servicing my members and community? 


And, there you go your Card 1 is ready! ‚ô•Ô∏è


PS: You don't need to use this style for the card, you could also directly start executing everything you have written in your format and rituals on the Spaceboard to your cards OR even simply just introduce yourself! 



Card 1 down, 5 more to go!


What is going to be the headline of your first card? Drop them in the comments below üòå

Did we just launch? üîñ


TALK OF THE TOWN IS FINALLY OUT IN OPEN! üóûüóû


We have 3 Space Warriors who became the first set of students to launch their space on the Under 25 App.


23.10.21 is going down in history üìú



Pannagasri G | Under 25 BMSCW




She is the first SW to launch her space offline! BMSCW is a girls college & Pannagasri is all set to amplify student voices from her campus! ‚òÑÔ∏è 


 Vanishree Kulkarni | Under 25 CIT




With one of the most detailed Space boards, Vanishree is on her way to take over her campus. Also if you have any Halloween theme ideas feel free to drop your suggestions as this week she is going to launch her space offline ü§≠


 Philip Sunny | Under 25 KCMT





One of the first ones to get on the mentorship calls & this boy is known for getting his MoU signed Under 5 hours! That's crazy, isn't it? Well, he's just getting started & fun fact: his management was so impressed by his passion to build this community that they've allotted a room for him & his team to conduct all operations for Under 25 KCMT ‚òÄÔ∏è

Card Title: Lauching your space without a mentorship call?
Card Description: Here's a step by step guide for you to understand how to launch your space!
Card Body:
As we close on mentorship calls this week there are still some space warriors who haven't yet got on a call with me & space warriors who have only done their first call üéõ

Here's a guide for you all to keep in mind to launch your space üåå

Steps to launch your spaceüß†:

  1. Space board review üéö
  2. First 6 cards approvals üÉè
  3. Sign the social media policy & send it back ‚úÖ

SMP: You will receive it via email once you've got your first 6 cards approved.

Once you are done with all these 3 steps you will be added to your space on the app & post which you'd get the branding kit üß™

Branding Kit: As Under 25 we have very high standards for design & how a space would look aesthetically. For the same, we will share a design kit that will have all the logo's, pills, colours, templates, fonts, that you can use to maintain uniformity in your space.

How do I get my Space Board/First 6 cards reviewed & approved now?üì°

Before that please make sure you've given edit access to your spaceboard before sending it across so that I can add comments.

Pick any one ü§≥üèª

  1. Use the space chat to send me your notion linküîó
  2. Email me your space board/ first 6 cards. (campusespace@under25.club, koustubh@under25.club)

This is what Noah Sama, Space warrior at Under 25 ISME sent me today & you all can follow the same format ‚úÖ

P.S. Give me better 24-48 hours to get back to you with feedback

Drop a comment here once you've sent me your cards for review üèÅ

If you have any more doubts regarding the launch hit me up in the comments ü§úüèºü§õüèº

One of the core reasons for their success was their understanding of their campus üëÅüëÅ

One of the things they did right was knowing what their audience will like & what's the most sharable contentü§≥üèª

With over 810 posts they maintained consistency to make sure the audience keeps engaging with their content & doesn't leave the space ‚ôü

These are some of my learning from the VIT Vellore case studyüß©

Let me know what according to you is the most fun way to keep your audience hooked to your space?

What's on your checklist?üèÅüèÅ

  1. Get your MoU signed?
  2. ‚õ≥ Launch your space? üö¶
  3. Build your space shuttle? üì£

Or

Have a 500+ member space? üëë

Let me know what's your 2022 checklist in the comments sectionüåª

Under 25 CIT has officially begun!üé≤

Vanishree Kulkarni | Space Warrior at Under 25 CIT

She has some big plans & has already found a rhythm in her college. Without even an offline launch or her shuttle, she has managed to land 66 followersüì°

She aims at 500 members on her space by the end of this year! üëë

Under 25 BMS: Ex Space Warrior | Kanishka Reddy

Dear VTU was a hard hit, solely because we were vocal at the right time. It becomes vital for us to know everything our community is going through to build the strongest community out there. Keep it real simple and current, and things will work out says Kanishka

52.9K SHARES GOD DAMM

https://www.instagram.com/tv/CAP7CL1jHlk/?utm_medium=copy_link

The page also gained over 500 followers overnight. This campaign acts as one of the best examples of Matter over medium.

The news is out!

10 Campus Spaces have officially begun ‚ú¥

Please note: All the Space warriors mentioned here have been added in a separate group with me & the Student Matter team. Please acknowledge in the comments once you've been added ‚úÖ

All the best team! Let's get the party started ü•≥

If you are a space warrior who is still hustling it out with your management, I've got you.

I know how bad it feels when everything you dream of doing as a space warrior at your campus comes at a standstill because of one signatureüìë

I had a very hard time getting my MoU signed. I use to see all my fellow space warriors doing Summit's, Insane campaigns, build their shuttle & I couldn't even get one signatureüò¶

The fact of the matter is that it's not your fault & all you can do here is keep doing whatever it takes to get that signature‚ôü

I have sulked so much at a time when I was in tears sitting outside my HODs office thinking that it's not gonna work out. I just wanted it THAT BADLY

Then one day it happened. Like Anto said on one of the WHS's, that you don't know what's on the other side if you are just consistent!

I got my MoU signed in September & then BOOM üí£

Oct 2019 MIT WPU was announced as the Fastest growing page & The most Impactful campus of the monthü§Ø

So here's what I want to tell all of you champions who are still banking on getting the MoU signed ‚úÖ

Don't you dare feel like it's your fault! & if you just keep doing what you are doing, it's gonna come through.

Walk past your insecurities: A campaign where you find a busy area on campus & put a chart paper on a soft board with the heading "Walk past your insecurities".

This activity aims at being an outlet for people to openly talk about their insecurities and walk past them & never again look back.

This activity first started at MIT WPU back in 2019 & the above images are from there.

After a long break due to Covid, we are finally (Some What back) back on campuses! And Under 25 BMSCW brought back walk past your insecurities but in their fashion!

Pannagasri G | Space Warrior at Under 25 BMSCW

Launched her Space offline & ended her banger launch with WPYI & here's how it went down.

Big up to Under 25 BMSCW & Pannagasri for pulling this off‚ù§

Let me know in the comments!

Make way for the Teresians!

Meenakshi Iyer & Nicole Fegy | Space Warriors at Under 25 STC

I've personally seen a lot of space boards by now & the most common mistake which all of us tend to make is to not add enough detailing. Then I come across this one space board & I had to share it with all of you!üçì Btw they had a 3D animation of a Bubble Gum pack as their icon ü•∫‚ù§

Thank you ,Rohit! if you are reading this you made my day‚ù§

Vanishree Kulkarni | Under 25 CIT


Quoting Vanishree üí•


The idea behind the "Passing on Positivity" board was that you take a positive message that you "need" to hear or "give" a positive or uplifting message for someone else.



We displayed the "Passing on Positivity" board in the centre pillar of the Seminar Hall.


We had 6 different topics on positivity and each topic had around 30 motivating quotes related to that topic and students picked whichever they felt is good and gave it to a stranger.


Being appreciated goes a long way and it doesn't take much effort to appreciate the people around you, be it strangers or friends.



So many of us get so busy we often forget the basic, beautiful, simplicity of simple kindness. Be kind whenever you can, it may be the only kindness someone receives that day. So many easy, fun, and inexpensive ideas.


Paying it forward is wonderful, but it has to start somewhere, let it start with you today.


Kudos to her efforts to make something like this come alive & gifting so many people with a smileüí´


Drop one quote that motivates you every time you feel low & let's make the comments section our motivation repository!üåª

Card Description: It's time we take over the world üåé
Card Body:
Everything happens for a reason!


You must be wondering who am I & what am I doing here right?


So here it goes, I come from Pune & I studied in this college called MIT WPU, heard of it before? It's also known for being one of the biggest campuses in the country with over 25,000 students! Ain't that crazy?


As I started my journey with Under 25 after becoming a Space Warrior of this humongous campus in my second year of college there was so much going on in my mind.


Am I doing what I love? Will I meet like-minded people? How do I stand out & build my own identity?


I had so much to figure out all by myself.


Jumpcut to October 2019


My alongside my lovely team had organised multiple experiences on campus, launched more than 5 campaigns on our Instagram page. Became the most followed space of our college by producing original content daily!



Yes, it was overwhelming but it was just some college kids trying to push boundaries & express themselves unapologetically.



Today as I write this article for you, I still feel like that kid who walked in that larger than life campus.


Student Creator Fellowship is India's largest Creator Fellowship with top talents across 183 cities & 5 countries.



The Launch Campaign for this fellowship has over 6 lakh impressions & we wrapped the campaign with the first-ever Creator Camp at the Under 25 HQ.



Building a space like this has been a dream project & I want to promise each one of you that if you submit to the process it's going to move mountains for you.


This is me officially welcoming each one of you to the Student Creator Fellowship ‚ö°


Koustubh Kulkarni

Team Lead, Student Creator Fellowship

Card Description: What do missions mean? How will they help you as a fellow? Tap to know!üö®
Card Body:
Missions: A task and activity that an RC (Resident Creator) will be assigned to in the fellowship. Your credibility as an RC depends on the number of missions you've completed.


The more missions you complete the more you unlock in the fellowship.

Mission 01: Pose Pose Photoshoot! üì∏



üö¶Brief:

It's time to brag! You made it:


üõ¢We are updating our website with all of your pictures and hence we need you to send us your High Res Picture of you.


üõ¢ It should ne an individual picture, No group pictures, please!


üõ¢Show us who you are! Wear something Pop, Unique, and You!


‚úÖ Elements:


  • High-Resolution picture portrait (1080*1920)
  • Make sure your face is facing towards the camera.
  • The image should not be full-length, waist-length pictures are preferred. Refer to the examples for more clarity!
  • Rename your image before uploading it on the google form.
  • Upload before 7th January (Friday), 11:59 pm.


üî† Steps to Rename & Upload:


Rename your images as mentioned below before uploading them on the Google form.


1. {FirstName_LastName}

Example: Koustubh_Kulkarni


üì∏ Samples



Upload your pictures here!


Let me know in the comments once you are done!‚úÖ

Card Description: I completed my first mission what do I do next? üß†
Card Body:
I got a lot of messages regarding doubts & queries about the fellowship. So here's me clearing the most common doubts for everyone üëÅüëÅ


üèÅ Am I on track if I've finished my first mission?


Yes, Only 1 mission is out right now. If you've completed it then just get used to the Student Creator Fellowship Space by viewing all cards.


üîÆ When will we have our first creator academy session?


January we officially start with the creator academy sessions.


üéÖüèª Why aren't we getting more missions right now?


As it's the holiday season, we want to pace the missions out for everyone's convenience.


üåü Can I share my acceptance letter on my LinkedIn?


Yes! Flex all you want. You can also update your Instagram bios. As Resident Creator at Under 25 Official & Big Bang Social (by tagging the Instagram accounts)


üì£ When will we get access to our Big Bang Social dashboard?


In January post the Kick-Off Festival (Date reveal coming soon)


üèãüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è What are Drills & when will they happen?


A drill takes the Fellow through the ins & outs of the fellowship. Each day you will get a new drill & which means new learning every day.


Drills will give you a greater understanding of your responsibilities, how can you excel in the fellowship, best practices and provide more context about the fellowship.


Drills will start right after the kickoff festival.


üì° The Space chat disappeared yesterday did I miss out on anything?


All the official communication comes only via cards on the space, so no need to worry until you are checking all the cards.



I'll revert to all your question in the comments section!

And if you are on track then let me know in the comments üèÅ

Shout out to Ishpreet for this one! üí´



After reading all your applications, I realised most of you are here for more collaborative opportunities. So here's your chance to plug yourself!üîÆ


It is my sincere request for all RCs to not hold back. All of you are working very hard to make your content & now its time you start flexing it harderüí•


Drop your creation genre in the comments & start connecting ‚ù§

As there are over 350 Creators in the fellowship as of now, it can be difficult to track what everyone is up to.


It's always good to see your fellow RCs do epic work as it only inspires us to be the best versions of ourselves!


Here's what you need to do if you want all RCs to see your work every day!


Step 01: Follow the Student Creator Fellowship Hashtag on Instagram.



Here's a link to a video that will help you track the hashtag! Go follow it right away!

#StudentCreatorFellowship


Step 02: Use the Hashtag In all your Reels, Videos or Posts from here on!


If you use the hashtag, I can automatically track all your work. We'd all sure want to raid your comments to give you all the engagement you deserve ‚ù§


All steps complete? Drop a comment and let me know!üí•

If you are wondering how will this fellowship help you, this card is for you!


The objectives of the fellowship are broken down into 2 main brackets, namely:


1. Discoverability üåç

2. Monetisation üí∞

_______________________________________________________


One main problem that EVERY creator faces at some point in their journey is reach.


This fellowship will give you opportunities to collaborate in IPs, Campaigns, Events & Discussions that will increase your chances of being discovered.


An example would beüèÅ: Getting a chance to make a reel for Under 25 Dictionary üí•

_______________________________________________________


One main reason why there is a risk factor involved in pursuing content creation full time is that there is no steady flow of revenue coming in every month.


What if I told you there is a way where you can strategize this better so that you get more security to pursue this field full time?


Monetisation will help you generate a revenue stream for your Profile or Identity.


An example would be: Learn how to start your own merch line or figure out how to commercialize your content on your page so if and when you get brand deals you are not left clueless but are fully prepared to see it through in your own way üí∞

_______________________________________________________

Which creator problem according to you is bigger, Discoverability üåç or Monetisationüí∞? Let me know in the comments section üîΩ

There will be multiple types of missions coming your wayüåç


It's very critical for you to pay a close attention to all the cards cause if you miss out on any communication you lose out on an opportunity.


üèÅLet me break down some types of missions:



We will only have limited slots for these missions. RCs who revert first get the opportunity to be a part of these ‚úÖ


Example: Get featured in an Ad for xyz brand (brief will be given so you can choose if you want to take part or not). Intake 10 RCs, comment if you sre interested & the first 10 creators will be added to a group with more details.



Area of expertise will come into the picture hereüî∞


Example: Dancer attention, please! We have something in store for you.



These will be open for all regardless of the genre or intakeüì≥


Example: Mission 1 Photoshoot.



More types will be added soon!

If this card gets 100 comments by 10 PM I will drop Mission Number 2 today itself ;)

Card Description: Limited Intake! First 20 RCs to comment get in!
Card Body:
üéÆRequirement:

A short video bite, not more than 20/30 seconds talking about your thoughts/ motivation to join the fellowship & as a creator. How do want to make the most of this opportunity? You will be added to a group where you will get more details on the same.


üì≥ Brief:

The videotape will be featured on the Big Bang social website landing page. This mission will help you with discoverability.


‚úÖ Elements:


The timeline for this will be 4th January by 5 PM. So only if you are available between today & tomorrow, you should consider taking this up.


‚ö°Steps:

Comment below & the first 20 RCs who comment get a chance to be a part of this mission.


Let's get going RCs! üé∞

Let me tell you a story about this cool thing that I discovered recently üóØ


Have you ever wondered how does one make their dream into a reality?


Or what does reality even mean? Here it comes!




üîÖThe state of things as they actually exist, as opposed to an idealistic or notional idea of them.



üîÖ Reality is¬†the sum or aggregate of all that is real or existent within a system, as opposed to that which is only imaginary.


üîÖIn physical terms, reality is the totality of a system, known and unknown


üí≠ Still too complicated right? You must be wondering whatt is all this?


I get it I GET YOU!




All you have to know about the kick off festival is that. This is going to be the day when you see the world from a different lens, you find your path & most importantly you understand how to make your dream into a reality after this experience! üîÜ


Use the comments section to tell me how excited are you?

Card Description: Block your calendars for the 9th of January, 11 am onwards ‚è∞
Card Body:
What's "The Kick Off Festival", you ask?


The Kick off festival is a virtual festival that officially launches India‚Äôs Largest Creator Fellowship to the entire world.



With our fellowship of over 500 Creators across 183 cities & 5 countries, we aim to bridge the gap between the hobbies and profession of students, giving you the ultimate platform to showcase your talent!



What can you expect at SCF - The Kick Off Festival?


The Kick off festival will have Talks & Conversations featuring Subject Matter Experts, Top Influencers, CEO‚Äôs & Foundersüåü


These conversations will be directed to y'all (RCs) & will help you understand how you can align your current reality to your desired reality giving you an understanding of what's in store for the future course of the fellowship.




THE LAUNCH!


What do you think will happen when the top 500 creators of the country with a cumulative reach of over 2.1 million people fall under one arena?


They'll simply disrupt the internet üöÄ


With this, we open the gates for Collaborators, Brands, Communities and Institutions to collaborate with you all!


Dear Resident creators

Block your calendars!

Glue your eyes to the space!

IT'S TIME!

Gear up and sit tight, we're about to kick off!


Let me know in the comments if you will be attending the kick-off this Sunday!üì£

Who are pathfinders?üî±


As the theme of the kick-off is Road To Reality we are introducing you all to Pathfinders.


Meaning üîÖ


A person who goes ahead and discovers or shows others a path or way.


Pathfinders will help you to find your paths by sharing their experienced realities in their field of expertise.



Our First Pathfinder is someone who has an immense amount of experience in the field of brands üîë



The first person who guesses all the brands right in the comments section gets a surprise!

Driven by purpose and passion, Varun Alagh Co-Founded Honasa Consumer Pvt. Ltd. in 2016.


With over 10+ years of leadership experience in sales and marketing roles with world renowned FMCG brands, Varun has mastered the art of building a brand and making it

profitable üîë

Varun's LinkedIn


Paths Explorered üõ∞

Varun started his career with Hindustan Unilever. He then went on to become the Senior Brand Manager at

Diageo followed by a 4 years stint at Coca Cola where in he managed the ATL, BTL, Digital &Trade activations for Smirnoff and has been instrumental in launching Coke Zero in India.


Realities of Varun üîÖ

During his corporate stint, he has won multiple recognitions including Business Unit Presidents Award, the Above and Beyond Award and the I am Diageo Award. Varun leverages his understanding of the FMCG market to build MamaEarth's and its 100% toxin-free products portfolioüåª



üì¢ Varun is going to talk about Brands & The Creator Economy at the kick off festival!


Varun is going to be reading the comments! Send him all the love & if there is anything you'd want to ask him!


Also, more pathfinder coming out today! Stay tuned üå†

A pro at figuring out anything and everything, @theshreyansjain even knows how to keep students on the edge of their seats at all times even when it's a virtual gathering!


If you think dealing with stressful situations is a big task, this Marwadi walks out of every conversation with a smile on his face and everyone else around him. @antophilip calls him his better half and this man definitely is one side to the epitome of everything young.


A keen observer and team leader, the one who says "we'll figure it out", truly tells us the real meaning of team spirit.

Paths Explorered üî±


Co- Founder & CRO of Under 25.

Besides having found Under 25, he is an exceptional orator and writer.


Inspiring young India with his motivational speeches and quotes, he has the knack to make a mark in any room.

He writes the most relatable and motivational things always leaving you in a happy place!


Shreyans is going to have a fireside conversation at the Kick off festival on how to Align your current reality with your desired reality.


Note from KK üåª


This man has inspired me in so many ways when I was in college. Sitting in Pune I always dreamt of working with him as a Space Warrior. I also got a chance to host him at my Campus Summit in 2019, and after meeting him I realised what it means truly be a leader.



I'm so happy that all of you will also get to experience what I did when I was back in college.

Card Description: FAQs on Drills, What does a drill mean? How will you receive drills?‚ö°
Card Body:
Drills will all Resident Creators a greater understanding of their responsibilities within their role, and provide more context about the fellowship. Drills will take you through the Ins & Outs of the fellowship.



Drills will equip all Resident Creators with the necessary learnings that has to be applied during the tenure.


This will help you in achieving the following:

‚ö°Complete clarity on the roles & responsibilities of a SW

‚ö° The Do's and Don'ts of the fellowship

‚ö° Adherence to quality standards




To make sure each day is exciting, you will be receiving content materials in the following formats.


To enjoy the process better we just wanted to give you a heads up.

1. Cards

2. Podcast

3. Videos

4. Events (Meeting)

5. Articles



üìî Every drill is curated in a way where you get to learn something new so it's best to make/take notes for each day & maintain a journal for the same.


üîé Your go to slogan should be attention to detail. It'll come handy during your missions. Every video, podcast episode, article and meeting is curated with a lot of love, thought and creativity. Make sure not to skip any drill.


üí° For queries and doubts related to any of the drills you can use these mediums to address them :


‚Üí Space chat - Official group/ Direct Message


‚Üí E-Mail - koustubh@under25 club


All drill related communication will be done via cards.So don't worry about missing out on any official communication in the space chat.


Let me know in the comments what do you want to know about the fellowship?

Card Title:
____ at the core? 
Also show some love for Rishab‚ù§
Card Body: ____ at the core? Also show some love for Rishab‚ù§

We smiled, we were surprised, mind blown & we even danced! There is so much that I can say about this kick-off but I think that's a story for another day!



But here are some key learnings from pathfinders at the kick for everyone‚ö°


üíΩ Beyounick & Shreyans!



‚ö°You have given yourself an opportunity and told yourself that "I want to do better"...this first step is incredible so give it up yourselves.


‚ö°In this journey you are your own boss and you don't have anyone telling you what to do...I just read and watch motivational content to keep me going. It makes me feel like a nobody and get me to work harder. My 2022 goal is to stay super productive.


‚ö°Whenever I'm doing anything I only think...am I leaving behind a legacy or not. I want to constantly work towards the ultimate goal and not divert from it.


üíΩ Prapti Elizabeth



üéêPeople will be waiting there to pull you down, be pulled down because irrespective you'll have people who support you.


üéêIf you have a cause attached to your content, nothing like it because then you're also educating people.


üéêTake breaks when you want to take breaks. Don't scroll through Instagram or Twitter, don't check what other people are doing just talk to your friends, family and keep it lowkey.



üíΩ Dhruv Chigopekar & Varun Alagh



üéñMillennials trust themselves more than they trust the brand: Stories told by millennials resonates with other Millennials as it's more relatable and authentic


üéñBe courageous and take a chance, be courageous and ask questions, be courageous and just show up and be present. If I would have done that I would have taken these calls far more earlier.


üéñThere is no alternative to hard work. Show up day in, day out and just keep trying.



üíΩ Anto Philip



üéàValue that matter : Doesn't matter who is on the other side and what they think, Just go ahead and tell ‚ÄòI have got a story to tell.‚Äô What you tell should be just important to you.


üéàDon't get too attached to the canvas you are painting on, get attached to the art you are creating.


üéàDon‚Äôt let anybody tell you what you should do, be artists, Do what you do your best. Own it.




Here were some things that moved me & I'm still not over what happened on Sunday, I still just kept thinking was that even real? Am I dreaming?


I think this is what it means by Road to Reality üåà


Let me know in the comments what was your highlight from Sunday?üå§
What is Anto talking about?ü§î

Card Body:
Count this one as a high-level mission compared to the ones that you've done before RCsüè∑



BBS onboarding is the first step towards becoming an badged RC. You will have to complete this mission to be eligible for grants & monetization.


üíΩ Deadline: 20th January, 11:59 PM IST


üî∞Type: Mandatory for all RCs



üíΩ RCs get a unique Partner Code that helps BBS identity that you are an RC, don't forget to put that while signing up.


In your case if you click on the link at the end of this card it'll automatically have Under25 so no need to worry.


Partner Code: Under25



  1. Make sure you enter your email address and phone number correctly.
  2. Make sure email address and mobile number is verified and OTP is put correctly.
  3. Profile should be 75% and above complete.
  4. Primary Domain under ‚ÄúMy Work‚Äù section and Primary Platform under ‚ÄúMy Social media‚Äù section is correctly marked.
  5. Don‚Äôt leave sections (Me, myself and I, My Work, My Social Media, My Likes and Dislikes, My Preferences) empty.
  6. Don‚Äôt forget to click on ‚ÄúJoin BigBang.Social‚Äù at the end.



üî∞ The Set up is a bit long but do it with your full heart as it's gonna help you in the longer run.


‚òé If you face any difficulties feel free to drop it in the space chat & I shall help you out alongside the BBS team.

FAQs‚ùì


üé∏Do we have to use the same audio that's in the reference videos?

  • Not necessarily, you can take inspiration or use the same audio.


üö™Do the videos have to be one from the references?

  • Not at all, you can make something similar or just use the prompt to make something of your own.


üß™Is it necessary to follow all the prompts?

  • You can follow all prompts if your creation supports it but if you'd like to stick to one prompt that's also fine.


‚úÖ Can we do more than 4 videos?

  • Yes for sure, 4 just the base minimum. If you want to push boundaries & go all out then feel free to.


‚ùå Can we put the hashtags to our old videos? Will that count?

  • Nope, we want to see your new work. Old videos will the hashtag will not be considered as submissions for Mission 4.


üëØ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Can you post Reels that includes our friends?

  • Yes, you can shot with your friends too.


‚ùåCan we post pictures?

  • No, Mission 4 is a video only mission.

Can you believe we've already finished one month in the fellowship? The kick-off feels like YESTERDAY right?!üòç

First Months Project was the Creator Set up & all of you set up your profiles on BBS & Under 25 App ‚úÖ


üîñNow let me break down what does a project mean?



üè∑Every month will have an overarching theme. The Creator Academy sessions & weekly calls focus on that key learning for the entire month.


üè∑The fellowship's curriculum is designed in such a way where you will learn 360¬∞ of the creator lifestyle & not just grow professional but spiritually & also personally.


üîñIs a project different from a mission?

Both are very different from each other & not the same thing!

  • Projects focus more on the learning & understanding aspect of the curriculum
  • Missions focus more on execution and the practical side of these leanings.


üîñHow do we learn about the project?


üè∑We have multiple ongoing conversations throughout the month about the project.


Here are some ways on how it looks in practice:


Comment down below what do you think are we going to learn exactly for this project? ü§î

For every 20th comment, I drop a topic that we will be learning in this monthüîñ

Card Body:
Mission 5: #KRACrew



Under 25, BBS & KRA are putting together a Creator Crew.

A creator crew that will aim to showcase their creator skills, aspirations & stories through video content.


KRA is a symbol of disruption & individuality among subcultures that represent the STREET, we use this as a core theme to the content that we will now create to be a part of this Crew.


‚úÖ Eligibility Criteria:

Completed Mission 3: Big Bang Social Onboarding.



Campaign Storytelling: Take your style of content & connect Street to it.

Examples

  • If you are a dancer dance in the streets
  • If you are into fashion then adapt to the street culture.
  • If You are a food blogger talk about street food.
  • If you are a singer then sing the most authentic songs that remind people of the streets or you can shoot yourself in the streets.
  • If you are a comedian roast the streets.


You can play around with the narrative until and unless it looks authentic & real. Cover your story & how you would represent the streets



Pick any of the following brackets to tell your stories & add value to your audience.

üëüYou are free to do more than 3 videos & the more quality videos you do, the higher are your chances of getting shortlisted.

üëüThe Videos have to be a minimum of 12 seconds.

üëüThe medium of execution of this mission as per the brand is Instagram only.

üëüThe minute we hit a certain number of videos for this mission we will stop accepting more videos.



#Ô∏è‚É£ Use the following Hashtags for us to track your incredible work!


#StudentCreatorFellowship

#KRACrew


üè∑Ô∏è Tag these accounts for us to celebrate your work


@kralife_

@under25official

@bigbangsocl


Note: If you haven't used the correct hashtags & you haven't tagged KRA, BBS or Under 25 then those won't be counted as mission 5 submissions.


You stand a chance to unlock the followingüè∑




  1. Upload your videos & Tag KRA, BBS & Under 25.
  2. Don't highlight any other streetwear or clothing brand specifically. Tagging them will make your video not eligible.
  3. Use Necessary Hashtags
  4. You should be following the KRA Instagram page to be eligible for the unlock.
  5. Review of top videos - criteria is the quality & story of the video & not just the numbers & stats.


Deadline: 15th February, 11:59 PM


All the best RCs‚ù§ make the most of this opportunity & drop in doubts if you have any in the comments üí´
